alert.note: Alert for Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Francisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 5:58PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...TSUNAMI ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR ALL COASTS AND BAYSHORES... ...TSUNAMI ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR ALL COASTS AND BAYSHORES... * UPDATES... Tsunami energy continues to impact the Pacific coast including the San Francisco bayshore line and Monterey Bay. Several pulses of rapid water rises and outflows have been observed and are expected to continue into tonight. We are currently in low tide so there is limited risk of coastal flooding. However, the strong currents from the rapid rises and outflows are still capable of pulling people out to sea. * LOCAL IMPACTs... For people in the advisory area...A tsunami capable of producing strong currents that may be hazardous to swimmers... boats...and coastal structures is expected. Low lying shallow or channeled areas (such as harbors and marinas) should expect continued minor to moderate flooding. * RECOMMENDED ACTIONS... If you are located in this coastal area...move off the beach and out of harbors and marinas. Do not go to the coast to watch the tsunami. Be alert to instructions from your local emergency officials * FORECAST TSUNAMI DURATION... No estimate at this time. The Hawaiian Islands were under a tsunami advisory for approximately 11 hours but a longer duration for our area is possible. Thus, expect water levels could decrease below tsunami advisory levels later tonight. * FORECAST PEAK TSUNAMI WAVE HEIGHTS... Rapid fluctuations of 1 to 2 feet above and below forecast levels every 30 to 60 minutes. * OBSERVED TSUNAMI WAVE HEIGHTS FROM EARLIER...Rapid fluctuations of 1 to 3 feet above and below forecast levels every 30 to 60 minutes * PRELIMINARY EARTHQUAKE INFORMATION... A volcanic eruption occurred at 827 PM PST on Jan 14 2022, centered near the Tonga Islands. This product will be updated as new information becomes available. Stay tuned to your local news source and NOAA weather radio for further information and updates.
